website_summaries.verdict: A fast-heating panini press that makes quick work of quesadillas, pizza, and sandwiches. The best value on the market.
pros: Folds up for storage when not in use
Adjustable height for varying sandwich thicknesses
Green preheat light turns on when unit is ready to use

website_summaries.verdict: Though it has a few inconvenient features, it is also quite affordable and incredibly functional.
pros: Floating "cafe" lid design presses sandwiches firmly and evenly
Makes sandwiches of almost any size—impressive considering the low price
cons: The temperature isn't adjustable, which can lead to burnt sandwiches if you aren't careful
Grill plates aren't removable, which makes it somewhat difficult to clean

customer_reviews.title: Don't let it heat up first!
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing. There is no way to adjust the heat. It comes on like gangbusters and your sandwich will burn in just over a minute. I'm giving it 3 stars though because I learned a trick: don't, for the love of God, plug it in and let it heat up before you put the sandwich in. Put it in COLD and set a timer for 1.5-2 minutes max. Any longer than that and it's a charred mess. I dunno, maybe mine is defective? Anyway. Hate it. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Grant

customer_reviews.title: Grill works well but needs  some updates
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful looking right out of the box. Works well. But you need to stay there and hold the handle down in order for it to work. Also cleanup is super messy. And drips all the oil's on the countertop. The item was too messy and too time-consuming to use so we returned it for full refund no problem . I would recommend they add a latch so you don't have to sit there and hold it while it's working. I Dossow recommend a little cool collected fruit on the bottom kind of like we have in the George Foreman so you don't have a messy the counter every time you make a sandwich .
customer_reviews.author: SuperMomma

customer_reviews.title: Worn out after 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 4 months ago, have used it maybe 10 times. I cleaned it per the directions following the usual way that a person would clean any non-stick surface like this -- with a sponge and some Dawn dish detergent. As of today's washing I noticed that the non-stick coating is worn off about 6-8 of the "ridges" where I place the sandwich. I find that to be a ridiculously short product life. Buyer beware! On the positive side, it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: MtnYankee

customer_reviews.title: Handy little work horse.
customer_reviews.text: I typically do not purchase appliances with one use but this is so fast and handy that I use this for more than sandwiches. We are empty nesters and I eat alone during the week, leaving me somewhat uninspired to make much of an effort. With common sense, this unit is capable of other jobs...turkey burgers, roasted veggies, quesadillas; to name a few. I do wish there was a temperature control but cannot complain given the 20 dollar price tag. The surface will accommodate two sandwiches, even on oversized bread, such as rye.
customer_reviews.author: helen0225

customer_reviews.title: Surprise: You need a panini press.
customer_reviews.text: Whether you are a college student, single urbanite, panini lover, or just want a questionable gift, you needn't look any further than this. You may think now that you could have no conceivable need for a panini press, but with some culinary creativity it can become a hugely versatile tool. Other presses do more and maybe do it better, but those can exceed $150 for the same overall effect. I love mine and I recommend that you get one as well.
customer_reviews.author: andrewn2468

customer_reviews.title: Love this thang
customer_reviews.text: With our non-energy efficient cabin, this press has been a life saver this summer. It has been so hot (83 degrees in the kitchen-even with our window a/c) I don't even want to use the toaster over. This little beauty grills up some terrific sandwiches without heating up the place. The surface area is larger than the small Geo. Foreman grill. Also I like the fact that it is not slanted (we don't eat meat so don't have to worry about draining 'grease'). It cleans up easily. The floating top allows for different thicknesses of sandwiches and it beats using both a skillet and the toaster oven.
customer_reviews.author: B Rosko

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I use this at least 3x a week. I got it for Xmas from my mom and it is the best! You can get so creative with these. I will say the first time you use it, it will have a plastic-burn smell at first, it will eventually go away... one other thing I wish it had was an automatic “off” setting. There is a light when it is ready, but you have to plug it in to turn it on and unplug it to turn it off. Sometimes you can see a little spark.
customer_reviews.author: alfe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I love this panini maker! It's so easy to use - simply plug it in. I wish it had a timer though, but I'm always conscious to unplug when done. It could cook a little more evenly but for the price it makes a delicious panini.
customer_reviews.author: Zira C.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this panini press and my husband tried it the first day. It smelled terrible and while it did melt the cheese it never toasted the bread. So we had a very soggy, hot sandwich that was gross! We went to the store and got things for sandwiched and tried it again a couple days later and it wouldn't even turn on. Do NOT recommend this press, it is cheap and does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Martin

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My wife has gotten into making gourmet class sandwiches but didn't really have the right equipment. I thought this would be a good gift and made the purchase. My wife was skeptical about the product but agreed to use it on a gourmet sandwich consisting of Swiss and Gruyère cheese with turkey, bacon and smoked tomato paste. The sandwich bread was homemade sourdough. The butter on the outside of the bread burned, the cheese was still cold, the grill was impossible to get clean without scrubbing the cheap, thin non-stick coating down to the metal. We pitched it with the next electronics pickup. Really a waste of money, will be the last Hamilton Beach product we purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dilbert Speaks

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I make myself an egg white, sharp cheddar cheese panini and avocados on the side. Be sure to use the right kind of bread. I use ciabatta. Delicious and amazing each time. So easy to clean too. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: shoe fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Makes great sandwiches.
customer_reviews.text: Makes wonderful sandwiches, easy to use, easy to clean, sandwiches turn out consistent. I'm still experimenting with different breads and cheeses
customer_reviews.author: John E. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Don't burn your bread...
customer_reviews.text: It does do sandwiches well as long as you are around to control the temperature. To control the temperature you have to unplug, then plug back in and then unplug. We have found that it will burn the bread before it heats the contents if you don't take caution with the temperature. I don't understand why they didn't include a temperature knob. Perhaps the one we received heats up more than it's supposed to. We really like the way it stores and the ease of cleaning it. Decent value.
customer_reviews.author: JerryO

customer_reviews.title: Love the fact that it has an upright storage option
customer_reviews.text: It says exactly what it says it does. If you are looking for a machine to use as a panini press or toaster this product is for you. There are no buttons and only has one setting. It gets very hot very fast. The plates are not removable but that was not a deal breaker for me. I will soak a paper towel with water and a little bit of soap after it has cooled down and leave it between the plates closed. Other than that a small spray bottle of water usually does the job of cleaning this product well. Love the fact that it has an upright storage option.
customer_reviews.author: Leila Lirazan

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: We just panini'd for the first time with this and it definitely did the job! My favorite part is how nicely is stores, we're a bit limited on kitchen space and it hardly takes up any room. We've only had it for two days but after the first use I'm satisfied enough to give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: First one I had to return because of the scratch ...
customer_reviews.text: First one I had to return because of the scratch on the grill. This is the second one but I'm bot sure if this is toasted evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Prime member

customer_reviews.title: The best panini press!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I'm replacing my old HB panini press is because it looks so beat up. I've been using it for about 7 years and still works great, not a single issue! Great brand choice. I never looked at a different one. The new upgraded one is even better looking and a bit bigger. I can now fit 3 sandwiches instead of 2, awesome! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Silviya

customer_reviews.title: Just save your money and order something of better quality. This stopped working after four uses
customer_reviews.text: Just save your money and order something of better quality. This stopped working after four uses. I didn't abuse it in any way, just made some paninis and then it wouldn't turn on. It is definitely not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Alli Stu

customer_reviews.title: One edge of the panini is browned nicely but the other parts are underdone
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't heat evenly. One edge of the panini is browned nicely but the other parts are underdone.
customer_reviews.author: SAB51

customer_reviews.title: Usafe  and defective product all around truly Hazardous products.
customer_reviews.text: I was horrified of how unsafe it is It's basically hot all around except the handle. the first try to press a panini I burnedd myself completely unacceptable And if you have kids its hazardous to have it to have in the kitchen. Amazon should do a better job and curating product on their platform
customer_reviews.author: Yoav Cohen

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap and does the job. However, I ...
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap and does the job. However, I wish the plates were removable for easier cleaning. Not that it's hard to clean, but every once in awhile I wish I could remove the plates and dump out all the accumulated crumbs. Another thing is that the bottom of the appliance is made of plastic and it might melt a little bit if you leave it near something warm, such as a toaster oven. When I first got it, I didn't pay close attention to where I placed it and the bottom has melted/become deformed. It can no longer sit flat but is still okay to use. Probably my fault lol.
customer_reviews.author: C.Z.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: If I could give 0 star I would, save your money. It’s horrible, it burns on the outside but doesn’t even warm what’s inside. Unfortunately I bought it and didn’t use right away cause if I did I would have returned it but it was too late
customer_reviews.author: KATIACOCACOLA

customer_reviews.title: This Panini Press is easy to use and a quick clean up!
customer_reviews.text: Check out this awesome avocado panini I made with my new Panini Press! Really love this Panini Press! Great value and I use it a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this panini maker
customer_reviews.text: Love this panini maker! Plug it in, wait for the green light and make your sandwich! Easy peasy and everything is delicious!! So simple to use, easy clean up, easy to store. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I've bought and I love it. Can fit 2 sandwiches on it if needed, gets hot quickly, simple mechanics, and doesn't take up too much space. It's a life saver for my picky son who eats grilled cheese A LOT. The first one ran for over a year, maybe 2?, and even after being dropped on the floor and BREAKING, it still works! A little janky, but totally functional! Wanted to retire it so I ordered a new one (identical, save the color) and it's just as great as it's predecessor. Very happy mom and toddler.
customer_reviews.author: kkTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This little grill has changed lunchtime at my house. It's easy to use - just plug it it, wait for the green light, stick your food in for the desired time, then unplug when your done. We wipe the grill clean with a paper towel. We've learned to microwave the meat first (if the sandwich will be thick) so the sandwich is hot all the way through. Not having a temperature control makes using it pretty easy. The grill is either on or off, kind of like a curling iron.
customer_reviews.author: W. J. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Panini's make a great lunch.
customer_reviews.text: The clean up is excellent, Nothing so far has stuck to it, not burnt on cheese, jelly, pineapple everything whips off with a dry paper towel. They need better direction. Like when you put anything into the machine put it in the back and not the front or the middle. The machine spits them out like a Pez dispenser, all over the counter and the floor. It's the way it closes. Melted Cheese doesn't come out of dress pants as easy as it comes off the grill surface. They could through a few recipes into it too.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for the price
customer_reviews.text: We own a lot of Hamilton Beach products and we really like the brand. So we decided to get a sandwich grill. This was very affordable and since we know the brand we decided to go for it. The product is durable. It looks and feels sturdy. The cable is a little on the shorter side but that was ok. The only thing that is difficulty about it is that the grills don’t come off. So cleaning is very hard because if you put it under running water, the electrical circuit can be exposed to water which is not good. It does the job for the price though, which is good.
customer_reviews.author: Kumsal

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is really a good product for the price, but it definitely has its issues. 1. The fact that it has no timer is difficult. You have to just keep checking on what you’re cooking. 2. The placement of the back hinge makes it so when you close the lid, the back of the maker closes down completely while the front is not able to because of the sandwich(s). Therefore, the back is cooked more than the front. 3. Lastly, I have to be sure to butter the outside of whatever sandwich I put in there. Otherwise, the bread definitely burns.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine P

customer_reviews.title: If only it had a heat control...
customer_reviews.text: It's very well-designed and constructed, and I really like the smaller footprint and easy upright storage--I really don't have room for a larger press--but it's just TOO DARNED HOT! It burns my bread before the inside of my sandwich is even warmed. If you just want something to put brown lines on your cold sandwich, this is the appliance for you. If you want an actual grilled sandwich, give this unit a pass and look for something with variable temperature.
customer_reviews.author: D. McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Wish there was a heat setting since my bread gets ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish there was a heat setting since my bread gets burnt before the cheese even melts, but we still use it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hot to touch
customer_reviews.text: This press works great and is non stick. However the entire housing, except for the plastic handle, gets really hot and will burn you if you accidentally touch it. The top floats and has a lock screw to hold in place so it wont mash your food. But you cant rotate the top to fit whatever food you have in it without touching the HOT housing. I have burned myself a few times accidentally. Not good with kids around either.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: DIDNT WORK! They refused to return or replace.
customer_reviews.text: Would never bother buying again. Paid $15 and they wanted that much again to buy a new one instead of return it replace. Tried it the first time and it never even got warm. Wasn’t human error. Checked all electric circuits etc and simply a dud. Horrendous customer service and even amazon bowed out of helping. Such a waste. Worst quality and service.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: It does it's job
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second one. The first one lasted about 15-16 months before my son dropped it on the floor...just right and it failed to work. It was a pretty good deal and it worked well before that, so we went ahead and got the exact same one. I wish it had better cord storage and that the outside didn't get quite so hot while in use, but it does it's job. Works great for a kid that survives on air and quesadillas.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Knack (She Has A Knack For It)

customer_reviews.title: it makes a great panini or a quick grilled cheese in no time
customer_reviews.text: very very basic. doesn't even have an on/off switch and no other controls. just plug it in. it makes a great panini or a quick grilled cheese in no time. easy to clean. small so good for singles or couples. simple, basic, inexpensive and it makes good things quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Gard, M

customer_reviews.title: Get more than one!!
customer_reviews.text: I probably shouldn't say this, but this thing is underpriced. It's one of those things that you buy because it's got great reviews and a great price...get it home and wonder why you didn't have one before...and then worry that years down the line, this one will give out and they will be sky high then. So guess what?! I ordered two more! One as a gift and another on reserve for the retirement of the first. For $25...it can't be beat! Love it! Thanks Amazon! This is a winner all around!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saddest Panini Press I Have Owned
customer_reviews.text: This press heats unevenly causing uneven grilling of sandwiches. I have tried it several times, and all I ever get are burnt edges and barely toasted centers. It is clear that the heating element is around the edges of the grill surface, and not enough heat is getting to the center of the plates. I wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot In The Backyard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Loved and well used in my house. Well love Rueben sandwiches and this is perfect for them. I see a temperature control rating perhaps I don’t know it’s there because I don’t think it had one. But it works perfectly and you can just wipe it down with a wet cloth and it’s good to go. This is my first panini press but I would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to make Cuban sandwiches and it worked fantastic! Nice big surface, it easily holds two sandwiches. It however doesn't have a temperature control or an on/off switch. You plug it in and it is ON and ofcourse unplug to turn it off. Easy to clean and even easier is you use parchment paper to wrap your sandwiches in before cooking. You could probably use aluminum foil but I didn't want to take a chance on scratching the cooking surface. All in all great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Carr

customer_reviews.title: Panini maker
customer_reviews.text: Works great Only wish the plates came out to clean Most things wipe off fairly easy but if you get something really burnt Cleanings a bitch Just wish the plates came out other than that it’s awesome
customer_reviews.author: P.Caisse

customer_reviews.title: Red color is perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time we bought this press. We had bought the first one about 10 years ago. It was still working but it was quite worn off and we decided to change it with this one. This time we preferred the red color because it was matching with other small kitchen appliances. I believe we can use this one as well for at least 10 years. It is also very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Murat Sezgin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I bought it so that I could make sandwiches at work instead of spending money on fast food. So far it has worked like a charm. Please note that the first time you use it there will be some smoke from the coating on the grill plates but it's minor.
customer_reviews.author: Immanuel Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Get an indoor food grill instead
customer_reviews.text: You have to really like hot sandwiches and panini. If not, you’re better off to get a multi use indoor food grill. I do like the adjustable height lock for sandwiches. I wish the trays were removable to help with cleaning. Trays are not sloped and have a ridge all the way around, so not good for use with general food grilling, even though they say you can do it. Gets really, really, really, really hot - so you have to watch the sandwich or it’s burnt in a instant. I won’t buy one again and as I said in the beginning, unless you really like panini or hot sandwiches, just get a food grill.
customer_reviews.author: Scintilla

customer_reviews.title: I needed this in my life!
customer_reviews.text: I never knew what my life was missing until I purchased this panini press. Why make a sandwich on toast when you can heat up the whole darn thing? I have made so many yummy things so far and my family is loving having paninis instead of plain old boring sandwiches. It is also the perfect size for cooking on small counter spaces. Very pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: KT Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like this panini press. It does cook quicker on the bottom than the top but i just flip it. Great for the price. Cleans easily
customer_reviews.author: Gumbohead

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t know if we would really use a panini press so we bought one of the cheapest we could find that still had good reviews. So this one is basic. No controls, just plug in to turn on. Unplug to turn off. It works well and we have been using pretty consistently for about a year now. Now that we know we get lot of use out of it we will invest in a higher end one next time, but this has been fantastic for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shenry6789

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great Panini
customer_reviews.text: This product delivers. It doesn't have any heat control; for that matter, it doesn't have any controls at all. You just plug it in, and it preheats within about a minute. Once that preheat has taken place, it's ready to make you a perfect panini. I really enjoy the features that it DOES have, like the tension weight for the top, and the locking lid for storing. It's exactly what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Teall

customer_reviews.title: Fairly Impressed
customer_reviews.text: There is no temp control, no ON/OFF switch. Other than that it works really well. It gets really hot really fast. (actually will pop a circuit breaker if microwave is on. Powerfull) But, to control that, and heat sandwiches 'through', I just put stuff in it as soon as I plug it in. I have no other press to compare too, but I am happy and have used it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: I always wait to review

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: Our old sandwich maker died, but since the panini plates were the most used, I got this to replace. I like that it stores upright, since my husband never puts it away. It’s easy to use and takes sandwiches to another level!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Furtado

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller meals
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a good price. Build quality is great. I make large sandwiches so you really can only fit one at a time. Cooks good but not perfect. Slight temp difference in some areas. But still does what it needs to do with no worries. I would recommend for anyone cooking 1-2 sandwiches but for a larger family I'd find a larger model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How Did I Ever Eat Sandwiches Without This?!
customer_reviews.text: We love this sandwich press and us it often! I am much more inclined to eat a sandwich when it has been toasted and pressed, so this has definitely increased my percentage of sandwich eating at home, which is good for my budget...but maybe not my waistline. You can even press burritos! The sky is the limit! In any case, great product, does what its meant to do and is easy to clean which is always a big plus. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Decker

customer_reviews.title: Just do it.
customer_reviews.text: Do you want to change your life? Buy this panini press. Tacos, grilled cheese, quesadillas, sandwiches, burger buns, all will be improved by owning this glorious machine. It has one setting: on. And it's all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved it....when it worked! It made really great paninis but I was only able to use it exactly 5 times before it died and would not hear or turn on. Kids were really disappointed because paninis are their favorite. My 2 stars are overall based on the time it worked.
customer_reviews.author: MSMINB

customer_reviews.title: Every kichen should have one!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not new to cooking, but I am to the world of paninis! The vibrant red unit arrived well packed; I used cooking oil to season the grates. Afterwards, a quick grilled cheese panini (aka: sandwich) was achieved! Nice, small unit doesn't take too much room and is well designed. Very easy to use. Instead of having just a standard sandwich, I'm going to have a hot panini! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CR Mainwearing

customer_reviews.title: Very uneven toasts
customer_reviews.text: It worked okay for a while, but after months of buying it it started toasting SUPER unevenly, like my bread will be half burned and half completely white. Wouldn't recommend :(
customer_reviews.author: O. de Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Nice press worth the price
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this press for the money! Got it less than a week ago and family has already had cuban sandwiches, quesadillas, and lots of grilled cheese sandwiches. Heats up within a couple minutes, then takes about 4 minutes to grill the sandwich. Just wipe off to clean. Pretty simple. I thought before I ordered it that there might not be enough weight in the top to get a good press while grilling, but it's decent and you can push it down a little more if desired and it will stay. Well worth the twenty-five or so dollars.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Easy great awesome
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for three years. The only issue was a screw came loose on the hinge. That was an easy fix. We use this thing all the time. It’s not hard to clean in my opinion. If you don’t want to spend a lot you will be very happy with this. If you have kids you can make grilled cheese sandwich’s in about 60 seconds. I have reheated French fries , sandwiches and even some veggies. Heating tofu gets a little messy but again it’s easy to clean. Save me so much time.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: I would have sent this item back if it wasn't too much trouble and wouldn't cost me. I love the size, and that it can be stood up for storage, but there is no temperature control so it burns very quickly. Also, it cooks unevenly. I have to spin things around to get them toasted the same amount because the middle of the panini doesn't seem to heat up quite as much as the sides. I really hate that I spent so much money on this one when I could have gotten something much better for less.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Horrible very disgusting
customer_reviews.text: Horrible!!!! I really don’t like this grill. I mostly use it for sandwiches and I’m very disappointed. The press gets very hot and it burn the bread but the inside is still cold. It’s hard to clean and the outside also gets very hot I burned my fingers many times just trying to clean the grill. I used it few times but I’m returning it it’s to frustrating to use it. The only nice thing about it is the color/red.
customer_reviews.author: Danuta Solecki

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it I use it all the time Few things u should know: heats unevenly which is no big deal but for picky ppl out there u should know this and cleaning is a little hard since u can’t remove the plates Other then that it’s good product and hint don’t live it on for a long time like with any electronic things it will over heat and plastic will melt use it and turn it off don’t live it on in ur kitchen
customer_reviews.author: IS&KK

customer_reviews.title: Not something I would buy again nor recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a replacement for a Bella panini maker that gave up the ghost.. unfortunately that model is no longer available. The Hamilton Beach works fine but has a few shortcomings if I had seen one of these I would not have bought it. Down side; it does not have an on/off switch or an adjustable thermostat. There is a ridge all around the bottom grill that makes it hard to clean an difficult to remove ones sandwich. It may work well for some purposes but not as a Panini maker. Pam
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J. Doern

customer_reviews.title: Simple, slim, perfect for basic stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love the simple design, how it disappears in a corner. Very easy to use and upgrade your results sandwiches to higher quality. I don’t like how plasticy it feels, feel like the grill plate might be scratched soon. I also feels that temperature controls will be good to have. This is a good value for money but I would recommend stepping up if you are planning to get creative with the grill
customer_reviews.author: Rahul

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill mainly for sandwiches it's good overall it makes the sandwich hot enough to melt cheese without burning the outside but on the other side it's very hard to clean the grooves are very deep, and you should be very careful with the handle you can burn your hand easily. No on off switch and no way for the excess juices to drip out
customer_reviews.author: Lara M.

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this panini grill! Until it blew out when I unplugged it.
customer_reviews.author: HL1993

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean up.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Although temperature control shouldn’t be a star value, cause there’s only one temp, and that’s controlled by whether or not it’s plugged in. Makes great sandwiches tho!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Halvorson

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: It makes good sandwiches. The only issue I have with it is the temperature is not adjustable. The center of my sandwiches remain cool (cheese doesn't melt) and the outside is starting to burn. I have to microwave for a few seconds to melt the cheese inside before I use the griddle. Other than that, it's great. Easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: GreenWolf

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not durable.
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to use, & lightweight, & easy to clean. There was no temperature control, & it quit working after 3 uses. I used it for a large party (14 people-14 sandwiches) and it quit heating. We had to throw it away. People loved the sandwiches when it was working.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than three months
customer_reviews.text: An absence of temperature control settings was obnoxious, but my main gripe is that mine quit working less than 3 months after purchasing it. While operable, it was was easy to use. I am very disappointed that this panini press was not built to last. For the two months it actually worked, it made some great paninis.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Copeland

customer_reviews.title: This little machine packs a PUNCH!
customer_reviews.text: I love this panini maker. More than just a sandwich maker- I heat EVERYTHING up in this. Jerked chicken, fried food, patties - if it's been fried, baked, or roasted this will make it taste freshly done. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Sandwiches in a Snap
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite appliances. Makes hot sandwiches in a snap. Easy to clean and store. First one broke after about 3 months so this is my second or would have gotten 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Commandeur-Collins

customer_reviews.title: BEST INVESTEMENT EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This little panini machine works like magic. You can have gooey cheese drooling out of your panini in little time after in comparison to other panini pressses on the market. The only downside is that it’s hard to clean but not if you used a good amount of lubricant before placing the panini. Using it for almost a year now and loving it!
customer_reviews.author: SujD

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bad shipping practice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift. I already own one so I can attest to it's solid performance. The reason I removed a star is it was shipped in it's own box only. A gift doesn't look nearly as nice when there is a shipping label right square on the front of it. I'm all about saving cardboard, but this was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: RoyalSmash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kitchen gadget and very easy to clean. Does exactly what you expect/want, every time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this press a while ago and did not review it on Amazon. I have since made approximately a brazillion sandwiches (that's a technical term) and can tell you this is worth every penny. Joking aside, it does exactly what it is supposed to. I'd go in to more detail but basically, let it heat up until the green light glows, you put a sandwich in, close the press for two or so minutes (depending), take the sandwich out and enjoy. Once the press cools off take a slightly damp towel and wipe down the surface.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Cooking
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to this sandwich cooker but I just couldn’t get it to cook evenly. One corner/side of the sandwich would be black but the other side was barely even cooked.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B.

customer_reviews.title: WoW!!!! I love This Panini Press!!
customer_reviews.text: I took a cruise prior to COVID lockdown. They had the most amazing panini sandwiches onboard. When we got back home, I started looking around for a panini press. When I found this one with the red lid, I knew it was a sign to buy it! I have been making sandwiches a couple of times a week with this little gem of a device. I've told my co-workers all about it, and several have purchased this model as well.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Nice panini press that does its job
customer_reviews.text: Great little appliance! Just received this today and set it to work immediately. Made a terrific grilled ham & cheese. Got all the way through, crisp and clear grill marks. Cleanup was easy enough and storage a zip. Does not have a temp setting or automatic cutoff, both of which would be nice, but for the price, I can deal with unplugging. Definitely recommend this panini press.
customer_reviews.author: cch1950

customer_reviews.title: Great panini maker
customer_reviews.text: This is great it does a very good job with paninis I love it is easy to clean and everything I read about it is true the only thing it whould be nice is to have a tray to catch what drips when making other things but I haven’t done anything else jet and also you can’t adjuste the temperature but it was not inportant for me
customer_reviews.author: Marta Galvez

customer_reviews.title: Your new favorite kitchen appliance!
customer_reviews.text: You need this in your life! its like a George foreman on steroids! can cook everything from bacon to burgers to chicken breast to making grilled cheeses! it has literally became a staple in my kitchen and stays on my counter top because i use it for everything! been using it for 6 months when i write this review and have had no problems at all with it!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this product!! The candy apple red color is my favorite and it is so quick and easy to use! Just plug in for on and unplug for off, dosnt get any easier than that! I use a little olive oil spray on the bottom grill and sandwich top and so far my sandwiches are awesome! Great product and beautiful addition to my countertop. Highly recommend to everyone!!
customer_reviews.author: virginia krause

customer_reviews.title: Clearing some things up
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews mention it having no indicator wether if it’s done or not - but it doesn’t effect the excellence of this item at all. There is a light that indicates when it’s at the hottest spot, and then the level of crisp and how well you want it cooked is up to you. Overall excellent product, easy to clean, easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Yuli Young

customer_reviews.title: Works great, Design is horrible - burns you
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but the outer area get soooooooooo hot, and its so easy to touch it that you burn yourself often.... they should have build some more protection on top to reduce the "touch heat" .
customer_reviews.author: Da Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: No temperature control, no drainage, lip seal makes it rather subpar
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed by this unit. It has no temperature control. It has no drainage line, and a thick lip surrounding it making usage somewhat limited and cleaning irritating. It's also a little too small (for instance smaller than a "large" sized quesadilla)--with the lip this make it particularly inconvenient for certain cooking purposes. Disappointing for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Regret buying, doesn't cook evenly
customer_reviews.text: Heats too hot on the outside, so things are over cooked on the outside edges. Tried different ways of fixing stuff on it, heating it up first as suggested also tried putting the sandwich on and then switching on, doesn't make a difference, the middle of the sandwich gets cooked better if you heat the griller after putting the sandwich on but no matter what it always overcooks the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Frisque

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Didnt really care for it . You cannot control the temperature and once you plug it in to the electric outlet it start working on super high temp which always you need to be careful and watch while it's working since it burned almost every time my sandwiches . But it do its job if you stand near it
customer_reviews.author: Shlomi from New York

customer_reviews.title: In love...
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing. Had a Forman grill before and that was nothing compare with this beauty. We use it at least once a week. Easy to clean, easy to store. I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Gansita

customer_reviews.title: We have gotten so much use out of this since ...
customer_reviews.text: We have gotten so much use out of this since we received it! It heats up quickly and makes delicious Panini sandwiches. My daughter likes to make a brie and apple sandwich on white bread. Really delectable with a cup of homemade soup for a quick, Friday-night dinner!
customer_reviews.author: Marie A. Carmenati

customer_reviews.title: Not a good item
customer_reviews.text: Not a good item! Cannot be cleaned, it doesn’t have a button to indicate the temperature, only one red button showing it’s on! No green button indicator showing that the food is ready! I would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Anca

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Made nice sandwiches, but the hinge broke after three weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Hot “fancy” meal in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: Great for a quick easy “gourmet” sandwich/meal. This takes up very little space. Makes me feel like I’m having lunch at a little cafe, but in the comforts of my own home watching Netflix 🙂
customer_reviews.author: GirlPower

customer_reviews.title: Not really happy.
customer_reviews.text: Does not feel right, it is flimsy and when you try to apply pressure on the top the whose thing moves. Also it looks smaller than what you see on the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: This was the best and worst purchase ever. My boyfriend moved away for a year for work. He knows how to cook, but who doesn’t like a nice toasty panini at the end of the day. Big mistake. He had so many paninis. Then he bought a cookbook on how to make basically everything on a panini press. He made cordon bleu. He cooked steak. He made an honest to goodness cupcake on the panini press. He loves it so much. I’m glad he does, but also maybe he could learn to use an oven again?
customer_reviews.author: Beekeepers are great

customer_reviews.title: Potentially unsafe - can Hamilton beach please confirm?
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It works if you don't have too much stuffing. Cons: 1) It just would not start and plug in. I don't know how much safe it was, but I had to play with the plug and push them to narrow them end, try, fail and again push those connectors - so they could finally be connected to wall-plug. Never saw any electrical item , even china made stuff, like this! Potentially unsafe - can Hamilton beach confirm, if this is the way it's expected to ship? 2) Unable to adjust the knob to be able to accommodate well-stuffed sandwich (the picture shown by amazon looks fairy tale. My sandwiches are smaller , but still can't be accommodated)
customer_reviews.author: Peace&Love

customer_reviews.title: Nice Inexpensive Addition to my Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Nice little appliance for the price. Wanted an inexpensive starter panini press to give my 10 and 12 year old kids a quick and easy way to make quesadillas without burning down the house and suffice to say, this appliance was wildly successful! Plug in the power cord to turn on the appliance, wait until the light turns green and pop in a folded tortilla filled with cheese. Close the lid and wait a few minutes and BAM! Instant Mexican! No power button so you pull the cord from the power outlet to turn off. NON removable grills so clean accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: PitchBlk

customer_reviews.title: It is hard to clean!
customer_reviews.text: The material of device is good. The size is normal for sandwiches. However, it is so hard to clean because there is no hole to leak oil, so you have to clean with cloth or something. Also pieces are not separated, so it is not easy to clean. It should has a hole on surface to leak oil.
customer_reviews.author: Adil

customer_reviews.title: This worked for a while but the top and bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked for a while but the top and bottom are not removable panels so it's very difficult to clean. We used it for quesadillas :)
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I had been on the search for a panini maker for quite a bit now, finally decided to purchase this one. I'm so glad I did, both my husband and I work and sometimes making dinner can become a hassle. With this, we can just come home put a sandwich together really quick and have it feel like it was a restaurant-style panini. I also love that you can fit two sandwiches at a time. We have no complains, we have had a couple of friends buy their own because they loved it so much!
customer_reviews.author: jaaybeezy

customer_reviews.title: Easy for the family to make their own paninis!
customer_reviews.text: Received this as a gift and it’s been great for the family to come into the kitchen and make their own delicious panini sandwiches! All I have to do is plug it in and set out a loaf of bread and some ingredients to choose from. It is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: CallMeHNC

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Never have been much of a Hamilton Beach fan (since my wedding 26 years ago) but this product could make me re-think their quality. Great machine,excellent results and very easy to clean. Don't get me wrong, you can make a mess, but it will be your fault if like me you like Dagwood sandwiches stacked high. It still does an awesome job and if the hinges hold up it is well worth a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: gosigns

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Its cute. I liked the size and the lil nob on the side that can keep the top part open in whatever position you want. However, the temperature set is too high. It kept burning my paninis before the cheese had time to melt. I returned and ordered one with temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Artful

customer_reviews.title: Great item and great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine and we use it often. It is a little difficult to clean but not so hard that it keeps us from using it
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Dennis

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Electric Panini Press Grill with Locking Lid, Opens 180 Degrees for any Sandwich Thickness (25460A) Nonstick 8" X 10" Grids Chrome Finish,Medium
product_meta.description: Color:Chrome FinishMake your own restaurant-style Panini's with the Panini press gourmet sandwich maker. It will grill sandwiches of any almost any thickness. And when you're done, it stores upright saving cabinet space.
feature_bullets: Great for Paninis and More: Use This Panini Press to Try Savory Sandwiches, Quesadillas, and Sweet Fruit Turnovers Use the Lock Top Lid to Warm Personal Pizzas or Open Face Sandwiches You Can Even Open the Sandwich Maker 180 Degrees
Floating Lid: This Hot Sandwich Maker Features a Café Style Floating Lid That Evenly Presses Any Size Sandwich
No Need to Flip: Nonstick Top and Bottom Panini Press Grids Heat and Brown the Sandwich, Giving You Warm, Crisp Results
Green Means Go: For Best Results, Preheat Sandwich Maker 6 Minutes Before Use Built in Ready Light Will Turn Green When the Press Is Ready to Cook Your Sandwich
Top Lid Lock: Lock Panini Press Lid to Create an Easy Bruschetta or Open Face Sandwiches
Upright Storage: Easily Fits in Your Kitchen Cabinet or Discreetly on Your Countertop
Stylish Chrome Finish: Panini Press Looks Great on Any Counter
Dimensions: 11.6 Inches L X 12.6 Inches W X 4.5 Inches H

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,555 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
